alert.note: Alert for Polk (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 20 at 5:54AM CDT until July 20 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Dallas and Polk. * WHEN...Until noon CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 554 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Deer Creek at Highway YY, Opposum Creek at Bannon Road, Ingalls Creek at Highway HH, Dry Fork at Highway P, Four Mile Creek at Highway P, Lindley Creek at Mathis Road and Weaubleau Creek at Highway V. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bolivar, Buffalo, Humansville, Polk, Halfway, Flemington, Louisburg, Goodson, Foose, Pumpkin Center, March, Plad, Windyville, Long Lane, Dunnegan and Pomme de Terre Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
